page.title: 04CLYDEBANK WATERWORKS
page.content: Around 1870 Hardgate and Duntocher used Cochno Loch for their water supply but in 1872 a shipyard was built on the banks of the Clyde.By 1886 Clydebank was a town and needed much more water.Greenside Loch was added and that kept them going.Soon they found that the water was coming out of the taps dirty and sometimes the pipes were choked so they built filters at Cochno.By 1914 they found that the two lochs were drying up so they tried to find more water. Eventually they found a massive loch in the Kilpatrick Hills called Burncrooks Loch.It could hold over twice as much water as Cochno and Greenside and so it was added to the system.This has been sufficient for Clydebank's needs ever since despite the great increase in population and the large demands by factories.
